name: Glendavan House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a wonderful time at Glendavan House. The room - a suite, in fact - was more than comfortable. We even had our own fire in our own sitting room. The breakfast was among the very best we had in two weeks in the Highlands. The resident red squirrels are amazing, and there are great walks, and very good restaurants, in the immediate vicinity. But the best of all was Moira and Rebecca's welcome, which was simply stupendous. One drawback : normally one can only reserve for a minimum of two nights, but given the experience, you my regret not spending longer.
reviews.title: The warmest welcome of all

likes.liked: — The four-poster bed, the fire and the shower

reviews.text: During our 14 day tour of Scotland, we experienced some very good B+B's but Glendavan House was right there up at the top.
reviews.title: Second time here - its just fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow, what can I say about glendavan? We stayed in the ogston suite and were pleasantly surprised, if this is a five star b&b then I'll never use a hotel again. The room came with a lovely homely drawing room and private conservatory where you can relax and watch the red squirrels play on the decking most nights. The family who run glendavan are the nicests hosts you'll ever meet and the breakfast just superb. Glendavan is surrounded by beautiful walks and lovely villages and for a weekend break or weeks holiday I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this lovely b&b to the closest family!
reviews.title: The friendliest bed and breakfast ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous place. Met by owner on arrival and given personal guide through the apartment as had booked the suite. The suite was better than could be expected. Both the bedroom and lounge were furnished to "Royalty" standard. The full bathroom includes a shower and a deep jacuzzi bath. It was great. There is also a large conservatory off the lounge which gives access to a large secluded decked area which attracts all sorts of birds and other wildlife. When I stayed it was visited regularly by a family of red squirrel. The house does not cater for meals (although snacks are provided for the very late arrivals). However they recommend some local hostelries. We choose the Victoria in Dinnet which was also first class and very reasonably priced. Breakfast was served in a communal dining room The menu was very extensive and all that was served was fab. A large kitchen / pantry is available to use for teas / coffee etc as and when you wish. This area also incorporates a large selection of wines (including champagne), beers and spirits which you help yourself to and are paid for on an honestly basis. The prices are very little above High Street shop prices so no need to take your own. All in all a fabulous place - Just how it should be some would say !
reviews.title: Six Star Accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Davan Suite. Our stay exceeded our expectations, the complimetary tea, coffee, biscuits and port are a lovely touch. Breakfast is superb. Alan, Moira and Rebecca are wonderful hosts - recommendations about what to do and where to eat are spot on but not foisted upon you. All in all, the whole experience is excellent value for money and we shall be returning soon.
reviews.title: Like being at home - only better.

reviews.title: Delightful stay at Glendavan

likes.disliked: — Leaving and staying only the one night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Glendavan was simply delightful, and a great find! We stayed here for our honeymoon for one night, and our only regret was not staying for longer. We were welcomed to the house by Rebecca, who was an absolutely charming hostess. She informed us on arrival that as we were the only guests for the night that we had been upgraded to a suite of rooms in exchange for the room we originally booked. Our upgraded room was simply beautiful, and is definitely worth paying extra for. It consisted of a bedroom with a four poster bed, with luxury bed coverings, a bathroom with a roll top bath and a separate shower with plenty of huge fluffy towels and towelling robes, and best of all a living room, with wonderful views of the woodland, with its own coal fire, fully set up and ready to go. In the morning, we had the choice of a full Scottish breakfast, including haggis and black pudding! plenty of fruits and cereals, smoked salmon and scrambled eggs etc. Breakfast was in a beautiful dining room, where we were served again by Rebecca, and made to feel as if nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Kind and courteous hosts pure bliss!

likes.liked: — Kind and courteous host, stunning accommodation and best ever breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not hesitate recommending this place to anyone, and will definately be back!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay, we first stayed Oct 14 2008 and returned a year later, what an excellent place. We stayed in the suite upstairs last year and then the suite downstairs this year, the hospitality was superb,as was the food. The rooms are gorgeous, spotless and so comfy. The local amenities are great, good food, golf, river Dee etc, loads to do. Cant wait a year for our third visit and have agreed we need to spend more than a night next time so looking forward to a fantastic week end away as soon as possible. We have recommended Glendaven House to many friends. Thanks for a wonderful stay both times.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place cant wait for third visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first B&B on our scotland trip & it set the standard to a almost unreachable level. Honestly, it was just fabulous. Perfect wheather, perfect environment, wow what a room (absolutely loved the bathtub in the separate bathroom), superfriendly hosts & the breakfast was amazing aswell.
reviews.title: set the standard

reviews.title: Restored my faith in Scottish Hospitality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a pleasure then to trip over this little place- quite possibly the hidden gem of the Highlands! We had originally planned to head to Europe on the Bank Holiday weekend, but rushing to the airport to try and catch flights with tight deadlines put us off. Quite by chance we were wandering about Tripadvisor and found this place and it had a suite at a very reasonable rate available for 3 nights B+B.
reviews.title: Luxuriant, friendly comfort...

description: Glendavan House is a 5* Gold Bed and Breakfast offering quality accommodation in spacious and luxurious suites of rooms. Each suite comprises large bedroom, en-suite bathroom and en-suite sitting room with real coal fires that will be lit for you in the evenings. The Ogston Suite also comprises a lovely conservatory from which you can watch the army of red squirrels and birds that play on the decking outside. Situated in glorious and peaceful countryside fringing the Muir of Dinnet Nature reserve and within the Cairngorms National Park, Glendavan House offers a fabulous retreat from busy life. Peace and relaxation guaranteed.
